reference.title: Engine limitations
reference.shortdesc: While you can safely operate the engines at up to 100% of the power level, there is also a requirement to operate at a range of powers levels.

section.p: An upper range of 109% has been set as a temporary override to the engine limits. This may be run for up to 600 seconds of operation.

note.p: Actual flight performance has not been tested beyond time and power levels for more than 600 seconds. Exceeding this can permanently damage the vehicle.

section.p:
The primary computer system monitors the temperature of the turbopump components including:
high pressure fuel pump
high pressure oxidizer
high pressure pump at low temperature
Temperatures exceeding operating limits will result in a main engine shutdown. If the captain has manually prevented this the temperature can be forced to exceed limits.
